alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Western Essex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 11:12AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Essex County through 1215 PM EDT... At 1112 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from North Andover to Swampscott. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. Broad areas of rotation have been observed by radar and could lead to funnel clouds. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Locations impacted include... Lynn, Haverhill, Peabody, Methuen, Salem, Beverly, Gloucester, North Andover, Danvers, Marblehead, Newburyport, Amesbury, Swampscott, Ipswich, Middleton, Salisbury, Georgetown, Boxford, Hamilton, and Rockport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. These storms may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
